title: Student examples
list: Check out this awesome lab 6 stretch goal!

title: How will this lab help me?

list.problem: This lab will teach you how to run A/B testing using Google Analytics. This is a fundamental skill for testing user behavior on the web, and assignment 8, and especially assignment 9 includes these tasks!
Install pageview analytics on your portfolio.

comment: If you need to find the tracking code again later...
title: Tracking Code

list.problem: Where do I get my code again if I've lost it?
list.fix: Use the instructions on the next slide.

list.problem: Run an A/B test on a grid vs. the old vertical layout

list.fix: Did you add the route in app.js? (See Prev Slide)

comment: Send a boolean flag to the template
title: Hint

list.problem: Hint: Slide 16-Sending different data to the template may have relevant information.

list.fix: Restart node and maximize your browser window.

comment: Record an event whenever the user clicks a Like button on a project
title: Hint

list.problem: How do I register a user click?
list.fix: Check back to Lab 3 slide 42-Listening to clicks

list.problem: How do I add the Google Analytics event?
list.fix:
Remember back from slide 12-Store any kind of event on the form of 
ga("send", "event", <Category>, <Action>);
Substitute out category 'like' into <Category>, and our action 'click' into <Action>, and place it in the click event handler.

list.fix: Make sure you inserted the code on step 3 inside the <head>...</head> block of index.handlebars

list.problem: How do I clear my cookies so I can see an alternate version of the site?
list.fix: You can do this by going to google chrome's settings, Show Advanced Settings→Content settings→All Cookies and Site Data. From there, search your heroku URL and Remove the cookie, like below.
